Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit16TileGridP.name: TileGridPosition
Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit16TileGridP.abstract: A point on a tile grid (such as a tile layer)

Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit12TileGridS.name: TileGridSize
Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit12TileGridS.abstract: The dimensions of a tile grid (such as map or tile layer)

Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit4Patha.name: Path
Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit4Patha.abstract: Any array of of positions describing a path in 2D space

Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit10Propertie.name: Properties
Typealiases.html#/s:8TiledKit10Propertie.abstract: A Dictionary of named PropertyValues used with any Tiled object that can have user defined properties (captured in PropertyValue)

Structs/Frame.html#/s:8TiledKit5FrameV8d.name: duration
Structs/Frame.html#/s:8TiledKit5FrameV8d.abstract: Duration the frame should be displayed in seconds

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: wrap
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Text should be wrapped inside the bounding rectangle

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: fontFamily
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: The desired font (if any) of the text

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: pixelSize
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: The size in pixels the text should be rendered at

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: color
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: The color the text should be rendered in

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: verticalAlignment
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: The vertical alignment of the text within the bounding rectangle

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: horizontalAlignment
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: The horizontal alignement of the text within the bounding rectangle

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: bold
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Specifies if the text should be rendered in bold

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: italic
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Specifies if the text should be rendered with italics

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: underline
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Specifies if the text should be underlined when rendered

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: strikeout
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Specifies if the text should be struck out when rendered

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: kerning
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Specifies if kerning should be applied to the rendered text

Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.name: init(fontFamily:size:color:verticalAlignment:horizontalAlignment:bold:italic:underline:strikeout:kerning:wrap:)
Structs/TextStyle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Text.abstract: Creates a new instance of a TextStyle object

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: point
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: The object is a single point (use the position property for its coordinate

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: rectangle(_:angle:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: A rectangle (with origin at position) of the specied Size and angle (in degrees)

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: ellipse(_:angle:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: An ellipse (with origin at position) of the specied Size and angle (in degrees)

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: tile(_:size:angle:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: A reference to a Map Tile (you must used the Map to retreive the correct tile) and a specied angle (in degrees) to draw it at

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: text(_:size:angle:style:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: a String to render within the specied Size, at the specified angle (in degrees). The TextStyle defines the style that should be used to

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: polygon(_:angle:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: A closed polygon (with origin at position) with the specied Path and angle (in degrees)

Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.name: polyline(_:angle:)
Structs/Object/Kind.html#/s:8TiledKit6Ob.abstract: An open polygon (with origin at position) with the specied Path and angle (in degrees)

Structs/Object/Kind.html.name: Kind
Structs/Object/Kind.html.abstract: The kind of object, together with attached data specific to that kind of object

Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.name: id
Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.abstract: An identifier for an Object that is unique with the Map

Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.name: name
Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.abstract: The name of the Object, or an empty String

Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.name: position
Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.abstract: The location of the Object relative to its containing Layer

Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.name: kind
Structs/Object.html#/s:8TiledKit6ObjectV.abstract: The type of Object together with any type specific attributes

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV7mapSi.name: mapSize
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV7mapSi.abstract: The size of the map in tiles

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV8tileS.name: tileSize
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV8tileS.abstract: The size of a tile in pixels

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV9pixel.name: pixelSize
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV9pixel.abstract: The size of the map in pixels

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV14rend.name: renderingOrder
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV14rend.abstract: The rendering order the map was designed in

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV6loade.name: loader(for:)
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV6loade.abstract: Creates and returns an instance of MapLoader which will load maps from Tiled tmx files

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV5cache.name: cache
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV5cache.abstract: Maps should be cached, as they are value types a new instance is created anyway so there will not be unintended side effects

Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV11newI.name: newInstance()
Structs/Map.html#/s:8TiledKit3MapV11newI.abstract: Returns self as it is a value type

Structs/TileGrid.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileG.name: subscript(_:_:)

Structs/TileGrid.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileG.name: init(_:size:)
Structs/TileGrid.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileG.abstract: Creates a new TileGrid using the supplied array of TileGIDs

Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.name: init(integerLiteral:)
Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.abstract: Create a new instance with the given raw value, note that unless you are creating a customized ResourceLoader you will not need this.

Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.name: init(tileId:flip:)
Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.abstract: Creates a new instance for the supplied Map globalTileOffset

Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.name: flipHorizontally
Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.abstract: true if the tile should be flipped horizontally

Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.name: flipVertically
Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.abstract: true if the tile should be flipped vertically

Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.name: flipDiagonally
Structs/TileGID.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileGI.abstract: true if the tile should be flipped diagonally

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: RawValue
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: As specied in the Tiled TMX format, a tile gid is a 32-bit unsigned integer

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: rawValue
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: The raw value that could be OR’d with a tile id to get the full TileGID

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: init(rawValue:)
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: Creates a new instance with the specified value

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: horizontally
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: Include if the tile should be flipped horizontally

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: vertically
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: Include if the tile should be flipped vertically

Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.name: diagonally
Structs/TileFlip.html#/s:8TiledKit8TileF.abstract: Include if the tile should be flipped diagnoally

Structs/Layer/Kind.html.name: Kind
Structs/Layer/Kind.html.abstract: An enumeration for each kind of layer, together with the specifc information about that kind of layer (e.g. the ImageReference for an Image Layer

Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV4n.name: name
Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV4n.abstract: The name of the layer, or an empty String if non was specified

Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7v.name: visible
Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7v.abstract: true if the layer should be visible

Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7o.name: opacity
Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7o.abstract: A level of transparent the layer (and therefore its contents) should be rendered with

Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV4k.name: kind
Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV4k.abstract: The Layer.Kind of the Layer together with the information specific to that kind

Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7o.name: objects
Structs/Layer.html#/s:8TiledKit5LayerV7o.abstract: The Objects contained in the Layer. Will be an empty Array if it is not an object Layer

Structs/Rectangle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Rect.name: init(x:y:width:height:)
Structs/Rectangle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Rect.abstract: Creates a new instance with individual parameters for the origin and size

Structs/Rectangle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Rect.name: init(origin:size:)
Structs/Rectangle.html#/s:8TiledKit9Rect.abstract: Creates a new instance with the supplied origin and size

Structs/Dimension.html#/s:8TiledKit9Dime.name: init(width:height:)
Structs/Dimension.html#/s:8TiledKit9Dime.abstract: Creates a new instance of the Dimension object with the specified parameters

Structs/Point.html#/s:8TiledKit5PointV1x.name: init(x:y:)
Structs/Point.html#/s:8TiledKit5PointV1x.abstract: Creates a new instance of a point from the given parameters

Structs/Point.html#/s:8TiledKit5PointV4z.name: zero
Structs/Point.html#/s:8TiledKit5PointV4z.abstract: A point with x and y equal to 0

Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV3r.name: red
Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV3r.abstract: The amount of red in the color from 0 to 255

Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV5g.name: green
Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV5g.abstract: The amount of green in the color from 0 to 255

Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV4b.name: blue
Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV4b.abstract: The amount of blue in the color from 0 to 255

Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV1r.name: init(r:g:b:a:)
Structs/Color.html#/s:8TiledKit5ColorV1r.abstract: Constructs a new Color instance with the specified RGBA (alpha is optional)

Structs/Color.html.name: Color
Structs/Color.html.abstract: Captures colors in a platform independent way for subsequent specialization.

Structs/Point.html.name: Point
Structs/Point.html.abstract: The Point generic captures a single in space.

Structs/Dimension.html.name: Dimension
Structs/Dimension.html.abstract: A generic type that stores a 2D dimenion (with width and height)

Structs/Rectangle.html.name: Rectangle
Structs/Rectangle.html.abstract: A generic type that captrues a rectangular region in 2D space with an origin and size

Structs/ImageReference.html.name: ImageReference
Structs/ImageReference.html.abstract: Captures a resolved reference to an image, including its dimensions

Structs/Group.html.name: Group
Structs/Group.html.abstract: A Group represents the collection of Layers a Tiled Group Layer contains (a Layer.Kind of .group)

Structs/Layer.html.name: Layer
Structs/Layer.html.abstract: Layers capture the contents of a Map can be one of four kinds

Structs/TileFlip.html.name: TileFlip
Structs/TileFlip.html.abstract: Captures if and how a Tile should be rendered

Structs/TileGID.html.name: TileGID
Structs/TileGID.html.abstract: Represents the reference to a specific Tile in a tile Layer for a given Map. It captures not only an identifier uniquely identifying the Tile (and the TileSet it is in) but also if the Tile should be flipped (see TileFlip)

Structs/TileGrid.html.name: TileGrid
Structs/TileGrid.html.abstract: Represents a two dimensional grid of tiles (such as that in a tile Layer

Structs/Map.html.name: Map
Structs/Map.html.abstract: Represents a Tiled map which can be loaded from a Tiled tmx file (other Tiled formats can be supported in the future, such as JSON). It contains the root collection of Layers as well as carrying the references to the TileSets used by the Map

Structs/Object.html.name: Object
Structs/Object.html.abstract: Represents a Tiled object (which are contained inside Object Layers). All objects share some common attributes (e.g. their position inside their containing Layer).

Structs/TextStyle.html.name: TextStyle
Structs/TextStyle.html.abstract: Represents the formating and style of text Objects.

Structs/Frame.html.name: Frame
Structs/Frame.html.abstract: Frames are attached to Tiles and reference another Tile within the same Tile Set as well as the duration it that Tile should be displayed

Structs/TileSetReference.html.name: TileSetReference
Structs/TileSetReference.html.abstract: TileSets are referenced by Maps, and all tile Layers reference a specific Tile and TileSet by using a TileGID. The TileSetReference type

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a Color from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a URL from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a Double from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a Int from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a Bool from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Protocols/Propertied.html#/s:8TiledKit10.abstract: Retreives a String from an object that can have user properties dynamically.

Protocols/ResourceLoader.html#/s:8TiledK.name: retrieve(asType:from:)
Protocols/ResourceLoader.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: Retreives a resource of the specied type from the specified URL. The returned object will be cached

Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.name: loader(for:)
Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.abstract: Construct and return a ResourceLoader suitable for the protocol implementer

Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.name: cache
Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.abstract: Instances should return false if they should not be cached (perhaps they are very large, temporary, or change over time)

Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.name: newInstance()
Protocols/Loadable.html#/s:8TiledKit8Loa.abstract: When the Loadable has been cached this method will be called and if the object should create a copy of itself it can do it here.

Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.name: subscript(layerNamed:)
Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: Retreives the first Layer with the specified name

Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.name: tileLayers
Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: All tile Layers in the container together with their TileGrid

Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.name: groupLayers
Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: All group Layers in the container together with the Group object, which is itself a LayerContainer

Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.name: objectLayers
Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: All object Layers in the container together with their Objects

Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.name: imageLayers
Protocols/LayerContainer.html#/s:8TiledK.abstract: All image Layers in the container together with their ImageReferences

Protocols/LayerContainer.html.name: LayerContainer
Protocols/LayerContainer.html.abstract: Implemented by any object that can contain Layers (such as a Map)

Protocols/Loadable.html.name: Loadable
Protocols/Loadable.html.abstract: Implemented by any type that wants to be loaded (and cached, and instanced) through the TiledKit Project

Protocols/ResourceLoader.html.name: ResourceLoader
Protocols/ResourceLoader.html.abstract: You can extend the range of resources and even the way resources are loaded by implementing your own ResourceLoader.

Protocols/Propertied.html.name: Propertied
Protocols/Propertied.html.abstract: Any TiledKit object that can have user defined properties

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa8TiledKitAA6O.name: subscript(id:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa8TiledKitAA6O.abstract: Get an Object from the array with matching based on the objectId

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa8TiledKitAA6O.name: subscript(name:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa8TiledKitAA6O.abstract: Get an Object from the array with matching based on the object’s name

Extensions/Array.html.name: Array
Extensions/Array.html.abstract: Extends Arrays of objects (as returned by LayerContainers) so that Objects can be esily retreived

Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.name: top
Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.abstract: Text should be aligned against the top of the bounding rectangle

Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.name: middle
Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.abstract: Text should be in the middle of the bounding rectangle

Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.name: bottom
Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html#/s:8Til.abstract: Text should be at aligned with the bottom of the bounding rectangle

Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.name: left
Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.abstract: Align the text against the left side of the bounding rectangle

Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.name: center
Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.abstract: Align the text in the center of the bounding rectangle

Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.name: right
Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.abstract: Align the text against the right hand side of the bounding rectangle

Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.name: justified
Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html#/s:8T.abstract: Align the text against the left side of the bounding rectangle keeping the right hand side aligned against the same vertical line

Enums/Orientation.html#/s:8TiledKit11Ori.name: isometric
Enums/Orientation.html#/s:8TiledKit11Ori.abstract: 2D plane of the map rotated around the z axis by 45 degrees

Enums/Orientation.html.name: Orientation
Enums/Orientation.html.abstract: Captures the different orientations supported by Tiled Maps

Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html.name: HorizontalTextAlignment
Enums/HorizontalTextAlignment.html.abstract: The desired horizontal position of the text inside the bounds specified

Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html.name: VerticalTextAlignment
Enums/VerticalTextAlignment.html.abstract: The desired vertical position of the text inside the bounds specified

Enums/FileType.html.name: FileType
Enums/FileType.html.abstract: The file types, and some basic information about them, that are supported by Projects by default

Enums/PropertyValue.html.name: PropertyValue
Enums/PropertyValue.html.abstract: Tiled user defined properties are typed, and captured as one of a number of PropertyValue cases with attached data for the specific typed value

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: tileSize
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: The size in pixels of a Tile. Note that individual Tiles may differ in size but this size will be used as an assumption

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: init(name:tileSize:properties:)
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: Creates a new instance of the a TileSet

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: Retreives the Tile specified by the index from the TileSet

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: loader(for:)
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: Creates and returns an instance of TileSetLoader which will load tilesets from Tiled tsx files

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: cache
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: Maps should be cached, as they are value types a new instance is created anyway so there will not be unintended side effects

Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.name: newInstance()
Classes/TileSet.html#/s:8TiledKit7TileSe.abstract: A TileSet should be the same across all Maps in a project so no deep copy is done

Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC16tr.name: transparentColor
Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC16tr.abstract: The color used in the image that should be treated as transparent (if any). This should not impact the interpretation of any

Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC6bou.name: bounds
Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC6bou.abstract: The rectangle within the image that should be used to as the final Tile image. This enables a single image source to contain

Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC15co.name: collisionBodies
Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC15co.abstract: An array of Objects that make up the collision area for the Tile

Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC4uui.name: uuid
Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC4uui.abstract: A unique identifier for the tile (where unique means another Tile with the same bounds would have the same uuid

Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC_6bo.name: init(_:bounds:transparentColor:)
Classes/Tile.html#/s:8TiledKit4TileC_6bo.abstract: Creates a new instance of a tile

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: default
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: The default Project which uses the Bundle.main as its resource root

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: init(using:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Creates a new instance of a Project that uses a different bundle as a root.

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: init(at:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Creates a new instance of a Project that uses the specied directory as its root

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: url(for:in:of:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Retrieves the URL for a resource within the project

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: resolve(_:relativeTo:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Resources a url within the project, if it may be relative, then you should supply the URL it is relative to

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: retrieve(asType:from:relativeTo:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Loads a URL for a resource (which can be relative to another resource in the project, very useful as Tiled often uses relative paths within projects, or across Maps and Tile Sets).

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: store(_:as:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Stores an asset in the Projects resource cache for later retreival via the supplied URL. In this way ResourceLoaders can exploit the ability

Classes/Project.html.name: Project
Classes/Project.html.abstract: Projects are the primary entry point for TiledKit. The project represents the root of all Maps and TileSets and the resources (such as images) that support them.

Classes/Tile.html.name: Tile
Classes/Tile.html.abstract: A Tile represents a 2D image that should be rendered when referenced on by an Object or Layer.

Classes/TileSet.html.name: TileSet
Classes/TileSet.html.abstract: A TileSet represents a Tiled tile set, most typically loaded as part of loading a Map.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
